title: 103_s1178
content: The Act may be cited as the "Great Lakes Federal Effectiveness Act" and establishes the Great Lakes Research Council. The Great Lakes Research Council is established to advise and coordinate Federal research activities for ecosystem protection in the Great Lakes. Within one year of enactment, the Council will assess research needs, Federal expertise, and make recommendations for fulfilling the Great Lakes Water Quality Agreement goals. The Great Lakes Research Council is tasked with advising and coordinating Federal research activities for ecosystem protection in the Great Lakes. This includes conducting an assessment of existing research programs, making recommendations for research priorities, participating in meetings and conferences, recommending data collection protocols, establishing a comprehensive data base, and ensuring timely dissemination of research findings. The Great Lakes Research Council advises on establishing a comprehensive data base for the ecosystem and ensures timely dissemination of research findings. Membership includes research managers from relevant Federal agencies and non-Federal individuals may also serve. The Great Lakes Research Council includes members from Federal agencies like NOAA, the Coast Guard, and the Fish and Wildlife Service, as well as other relevant departments. Non-Federal individuals can also serve as ex officio members. The Chairperson is elected by members for a two-year term, with a limit of two consecutive terms. Members are entitled to compensation for travel expenses. Federal agencies must cooperate with the Council to implement recommendations. The head of each federal department in the Great Lakes Research Council must cooperate with the Council to implement recommendations and provide necessary assistance and information as requested. The Council will invite the International Joint Commission to serve as the principal coordinating body and may reimburse costs for activities. This Act will not affect the authority of any Federal agency to conduct Great Lakes research. The Act defines the Council as the Great Lakes Research Council and the Great Lakes as specific bodies of water. It also defines Great Lakes research and the Great Lakes Water Quality Agreement.
